Articles.Content:
It's been a very long time since I built a model and for some reason I always used to find all the issues possible with animations anyway.... but:

I knocked up a simple model with doors ( in Max ), imported to Unity 5.2.4f1 with Rig-Legacy/Store in Root(new), Bake off, compression off, wrap default. Assembled the model structure in Unity & the 5 sec/150 frame anim plays at the right speed in the editor window, not just the import preview. However... if I point ModuleAnimateGeneric at it in game the animation's actions are all still fine, it's just it does everything more or less instantly.

I'm sure either I forgot something dumb or it's something to do with U5 I haven't dug out yet, but anyone got any ideas?

in flight? or in VAB/SPH? it's normal in VAB/SPH.

if you want normal playback speed in VAB/SPH, set  instantAnimInEditor = false in ModuleAnimateGeneric
The "I forgot something dumb" option then... thanks!

11 hours ago, nli2work said:

instantAnimInEditor = false in ModuleAnimateGeneric

Brilliant this has been bugging me for ages.
